choices.answer: A group of words that contains a subject and a verb.
A group of words containing a verb and a noun.
A group of words containing a verb.
A group of words that make no sense.

questions.question: Which of the following is a subordinating conjunction?

choices.answer: while
but
and
for

questions.question: A subordinating conjunction + a noun + a verb = a subordinating clause.

choices.answer: I understand
I don't understand.

questions.question: A subordinating clause includes which of the following?

choices.answer: A subject, a verb and a subordinating conjunction.
A subject, a verb and a coordinating conjunction.
An adjective, a verb and a subordinating conjunction.
An adjective, a verb and a coordinating conjunction.

questions.question: A subordinating clause is a fragment.

choices.answer: I understand
I don't understand.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fragment?

choices.answer: While she was sleeping in a luxury hotel in Paris.
Her jewels were stolen.
She cried.
Some were shocked.

questions.question: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

choices.answer: Because they worked very hard as a team.
After it was over.
They won the game.
Although it was hard.

questions.question: A subordinating clause includes which of the following?

choices.answer: A subject, a verb and a subordinating conjunction.
A subject, a verb and a coordinating conjunction.
An adjective, a verb and a subordinating conjunction.
An adjective, a verb and a coordinating conjunction.

questions.question: Which of the following is a fragment?

choices.answer: Jesus wept.
She screamed.
The cow knocked over a bucket.
During the most exciting scene of the movie.

questions.question: How can a subordinating clause become a complete sentence?

choices.answer: Add a verb.
Add an independent clause.
Add a subject.
Add an adjective.

questions.question: An independent clause has a subject and verb, but not a subordinating conjunction.

choices.answer: I understand.
I'm still confused.

questions.question: Which of these is a complete sentence?

choices.answer: Since I studied for the test all night.
Since I read every book on that subject three times.
Since I studied, I passed the test.
Since I took my time on the test.

questions.question: Which of these is a fragment?

choices.answer: After the clown appeared, I shot him.
After I shot the clown, he went to the hospital.
After I saw the clown.
After the circus, the clown went home.

questions.question: Which of these is a complete sentence?

choices.answer: When he drove down a one-way street into oncoming traffic.
When he looked into the rear-view mirror and saw a truck.
When he looked down, he crashed.
When he turned around.
